pair.Response:
Prompt: On October Term, 1898, the Supreme Court of the United States heard the case of United States v. Joint Traffic Association.
Response: In this case, the Supreme Court held that the Anti-Trust Act applied to railroads and rendered illegal all agreements which were in restraint of trade. The court found that the agreement in question did in fact restrain trade and was in violation of the Act. The court also held that the agreement was in restraint of trade regardless of the intent of those who signed it. The case number is 559.
